title: Advanced Cardano Smart Contract Analytics & Dashboard
summary: Current Cardano explorers lack detailed smart contract analytics, making it difficult for developers and users to easily track performance, optimize execution, and deeply analyze contract behavior.
solution: We will develop a dedicated comprehensive smart contract analytics with real-time dashboards, execution metrics, and in-depth contract behavior analysis tools for developers and users.

sub_fields.title: Please provide details on the intellectual property (IP) status of your project outputs, including whether they will be released as open source or retained under another licence.
sub_fields.description: Please provide here more information on the open source status of your project outputs
sub_fields.answer:
All outputs of the Cardano Smart Contract Analytics & Dashboard Engine will be fully open source and released under the MIT License. This includes:

Codebase: The entire codebase for the analytics dashboard, including the frontend, backend, and data processing engine, will be open to the public. This allows developers to contribute, modify, and extend the functionalities to meet specific needs.

fields.title: Campaign Category
fields.description: Determine the eligibility of the proposal for this category

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer: Most Cardano explorers show “what happened” (transactions, addresses, basic script views) but not “how contracts behave” at a developer level. Our prototype focuses on smart-contract performance analytics: success/failure patterns, execution/cost signals, contract interaction trends, and comparable time-series views—packaged as a dedicated analytics dashboard with APIs and exportable datasets for optimization and monitoring

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer: A working pipeline that indexes contract interactions from Cardano testnet (and/or mainnet where feasible), computes contract-level metrics, and displays them in a live dashboard (global overview + per-contract pages with drill-down charts and filters). It will be accessible as a public beta web dashboard, plus an open GitHub repo containing the indexer/analytics API, frontend code, and documentation.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Index and label N distinct scripts/contracts (target: 500+) and 30–90 days of interactions



Track tx success rate vs failures per contract and overall; publish distributions and trends



Aggregate contract interaction counts, unique interacting addresses, peak activity windows, and top contracts/dApps by usage



Beta adoption: 200+ dashboard users, 50+ developer feedback submissions, and 10+ teams using exports/APIs



Public metrics snapshot showing: total indexed txs, indexed scripts, median API latency, and weekly active users, with reproducible queries and links to on-chain references used for verification

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
Our advanced Cardano explorer will revolutionize smart contract analytics on the Cardano blockchain, addressing the critical need for in-depth contract analysis and performance optimization tools. We perceive the current lack of detailed smart contract analytics as a significant barrier to Cardano's growth and adoption, particularly among developers and power users who require granular insights into contract behavior and performance.



Key features of our solution include:



Real-time Smart Contract Dashboard:



Live execution metrics



Gas usage analysis



Transaction volume and value flows



Interaction patterns between contracts



Contract Performance Optimizer:



Identifies inefficiencies in contract execution



Suggests optimizations for gas usage and execution speed



Comparative analysis with similar contracts



Visual Contract Flow Analyzer:



Interactive visualizations of contract logic and execution paths



Helps in understanding complex contract interactions



Historical Data Analysis:



Trend analysis of contract usage and performance over time



Anomaly detection in contract behavior



Developer-friendly API:



Allows integration of analytics into development environments



Supports custom queries for specialized analysis



Our approach is unique in its focus on developer experience and deep contract analysis. By providing these tools, we aim to:



Empower developers to create more efficient and robust smart contracts



Enhance transparency for users interacting with smart contracts



Facilitate easier auditing and bug detection in contracts



The project will engage:



Smart contract developers



DApp creators



Blockchain analysts and researchers



Cardano community members and stakeholders



To demonstrate our impact, we will:



Track the number of developers and projects using our explorer



Measure improvements in contract efficiency for projects using our tools



Collect user feedback and case studies



Monitor the growth of smart contract deployment and usage on Cardano



This solution is crucial for Cardano as it will significantly enhance the platform's smart contract capabilities, making it more attractive for developers and potentially accelerating the growth of the Cardano DeFi ecosystem. By providing superior analytics and optimization tools, we aim to position Cardano as the blockchain of choice for sophisticated smart contract development and deployment.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
Our project will significantly enhance the Cardano community by providing a robust smart contract analytics and dashboard tool that empowers developers, investors, and stakeholders with actionable insights. This enhancement will lead to improved smart contract performance, increased security, and more informed investment decisions, thereby fostering a more vibrant and trustworthy Cardano ecosystem.



Value to the Cardano Community:



Enhanced Developer Capabilities: Developers will have access to detailed metrics and analytics, enabling them to optimize smart contract performance, identify and resolve issues promptly, and implement best practices more effectively.



Informed Investment Decisions: Investors will benefit from comprehensive data on smart contract performance and security, allowing them to assess risks and opportunities with greater precision, thereby attracting more investment into the Cardano ecosystem.



Improved Security and Trust: By providing real-time security alerts and comprehensive monitoring tools, our dashboard will help in early detection of vulnerabilities and potential threats, increasing overall trust in Cardano’s smart contracts.



Increased Transparency: The dashboard will offer transparent insights into smart contract activities, promoting accountability and fostering a more open and collaborative community environment.



Community Engagement: By making complex analytics accessible and user-friendly, we will engage a broader segment of the community, including non-technical members, thereby driving wider adoption and participation in Cardano’s growth.



Measuring Impact:



We will implement a combination of quantitative and qualitative metrics to assess the impact of our project:



User Adoption Rates: Tracking the number of active users, including developers, investors, and other stakeholders utilizing the dashboard.



Smart Contracts Monitored: Measuring the total number of smart contracts being tracked and analyzed through our platform.



Security Alerts Issued: Monitoring the frequency and effectiveness of security alerts and how they contribute to mitigating vulnerabilities.



User Satisfaction Scores: Collecting feedback through surveys and user interviews to gauge satisfaction and identify areas for improvement.



Performance Improvements: Assessing the optimization of smart contracts by analyzing performance metrics before and after using the dashboard.



Investment Growth: Monitoring any increase in investments into Cardano projects that utilize our analytics tool, indicating greater investor confidence.



Sharing Outputs and Opportunities:



Public Dashboard Access: The analytics dashboard will be accessible to all Cardano community members through a web-based platform, ensuring widespread availability and ease of use.



Regular Reports and Insights: We will publish monthly and quarterly reports highlighting key metrics, trends, and insights derived from the dashboard, sharing these with the community via the Cardano forums, social media channels, and newsletters.



Open Source Contributions: Where applicable, we will contribute components of our dashboard to the open-source community, encouraging collaboration and continuous improvement.



Workshops and Webinars: Hosting educational sessions to demonstrate the dashboard’s features, best practices for utilizing analytics, and how to interpret key metrics effectively.



Partnerships with Development Teams: Collaborating with Cardano development teams and projects to integrate our analytics tool into their workflows, providing tailored support and maximizing the tool’s utility.



Community Feedback Loops: Establishing channels for ongoing feedback and suggestions from users, ensuring that the dashboard evolves in alignment with community needs and preferences.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Our team possesses a unique blend of skills and experience that makes us exceptionally well-suited to deliver this advanced Cardano explorer with smart contract analytics:



Team Composition:



Blockchain Development:



Team members with 3+ years of experience in blockchain development, with a strong focus on Cardano.



Deep understanding of Cardano's architecture, smart contract functionality, and the intricacies of its transaction model.



Data Analytics and Visualization:



Specialists with 3-4 years of experience in big data analytics, real-time data processing, and creating interactive dashboards.



Full Stack Development:



Seasoned full stack developers with 4+ years of experience in building robust, scalable web applications with business and personal analytics dashboard.



Expertise in developing high-performance, user-friendly blockchain dapps.



Smart Contract Optimization:



Experts in smart contract development and optimization, with a deep understanding of execution metrics and gas efficiency.



Project Management:



Experienced project managers well-versed in agile methodologies and project lifecycles.



Track record of delivering complex technical projects on time and within budget.



Project Delivery Approach:



To ensure trust and accountability, we will implement the following strategies:



Transparent Progress Tracking:Utilize a public GitHub repository for code development and issue tracking.



Regular updates to the Cardano community through blog posts and social media.



Community Engagement:Regular feedback sessions with developers and users to refine the explorer based on real-world needs.



Open channels for feature requests and bug reports.



Fund Management Approach:



Structured Planning and Milestones:Detailed project roadmap with defined timelines and deliverables.



Regular financial reports to ensure transparency in fund allocation.



Resource Allocation:Clear budget breakdown for each project phase.



Continuous monitoring of expenses against project progress.



Feasibility Validation:



To validate our approach, we will focus on:



Prototype Development: Create a minimum viable product (MVP) of the explorer with basic smart contract analytics to validate our technical approach and user interface design.



Performance Testing: Conduct rigorous testing to ensure the explorer can handle real-time data processing for the Cardano network.



Community Beta Testing: Engage a select group of Cardano developers and power users for early access and feedback, allowing us to refine our approach based on real user needs.



Iterative Development: Implement an agile development process with regular sprints and demos, allowing for continuous improvement and adaptation.



Scalability Assessment: Continuously evaluate the scalability of our solution as we add more advanced features, ensuring it can grow with the Cardano ecosystem.



Compliance and Security Audits: Conduct regular security audits and ensure compliance with best practices for blockchain data handling and visualization.



Our structured approach, combined with our team's deep expertise in Cardano development and blockchain analytics, ensures that we can deliver this next-generation explorer with the highest standards of trust, accountability, and technical excellence.

sub_fields.title: Project Milestones
sub_fields.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?

sub_fields.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
sub_fields.description: The number of milestones required depends on the amount of funding requested. Please refer to the Guidance card on the right for details

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Project Planning, Technical Design, and UI/UX Design

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
**Project Planning**: A complete roadmap with milestones, timelines, and dependencies; defined team roles and responsibilities; and a clear scope for “prototype launch” (what’s in/out). A metrics plan defining what “smart contract analytics” means in this project (execution cost signals, failure rates, throughput, script usage trends, contract interaction patterns, per-dApp views).



**Technical Design**: Architecture for ingesting Cardano on-chain data and turning it into analytics (indexer choice, data pipeline, storage strategy, caching, API). Includes data flow diagrams, threat model, privacy assumptions, and a scalable database schema for contract-level/time-series analytics.



**UI/UX**: Wireframes + high-fidelity mockups for the dashboard (contract overview pages, trends, filters, drill-downs, alerts, export). Final clickable prototype covering the user journey for developers and general users.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: A roadmap exists that is specific enough to implement without rework (deliverables and dates are unambiguous). Technical design documentation includes architecture diagrams, data flows, database schema, and chosen stack with rationale. UI/UX prototypes cover at least the top 5 screens and key flows (search contract → view metrics → drill-down → compare → export/share) and are validated internally against the metrics plan.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Public repository contains: planning PDF(s), technical design spec, architecture diagrams, database schema files, and UI/UX wireframes + clickable prototype link (Figma or equivalent). A short “Design Review” note in the repo summarizes decisions (indexing approach, analytics definitions, and what can be validated by month 4).

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Backend Indexing, Data Pipeline, and Analytics API (Prototype-Ready)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: A working backend that can continuously ingest transactions related to smart contracts (scripts) from Cardano testnet and/or mainnet (depending on feasibility and cost), normalize them into an analytics-friendly model, and expose them through API endpoints. Includes: ingestion/indexer service, processing jobs for computed metrics, database implementation optimized for queries, and an API layer for the dashboard. Also includes monitoring/logging, rate limiting, and documented security measures for API keys and access.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: Backend can index contract interactions over a defined time window (e.g., last 30–90 days) and compute agreed “v1 metrics” (contract interaction count, tx success/failure rate, basic execution/cost indicators available from indexed data, top interacting addresses count, peak activity times, script usage trends). API endpoints must reliably return data for dashboard charts within acceptable latency for a prototype. Integration tests demonstrate correct ingestion, processing, and API responses under repeated runs.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Repo contains backend source code with commit history, API documentation (OpenAPI/Swagger or equivalent), architecture/data flow updates, and integration test logs. A short demo clip shows API endpoints returning real indexed results for at least 3 example contracts/scripts plus a “how to run locally” guide (Docker compose or scripted setup).

Includes accessibility/responsive behavior for typical devices.

Close-out report includes results vs KPIs, what was learned, and the recommended next steps for a production-grade version.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
96,000 ADA is our requested funding budget. It covers research and technical design, backend indexing and analytics development, dashboard UI implementation, testing/QA, a public beta launch for community feedback, documentation, and the required Catalyst close-out deliverables. The goal is a publicly accessible prototype on Cardano testnet (and/or mainnet where feasible) for testing and feedback—not a full commercial analytics product.



Milestone 1 — Planning, Metrics Definition & UI/UX Design (22,000 ADA)



Project Management & Coordination (4,000 ADA): sprint planning, roadmap, milestone evidence plan, risk tracking, and aligning analytics definitions with build scope.

Research & Metrics Definition (5,000 ADA): define the “v1 contract analytics” set (success/failure rates, interaction counts, trend windows, top contracts/dApps, unique interactors), validation approach, and KPI framework.

Technical Architecture & Data Model (7,000 ADA): end-to-end design for indexing/pipeline/API, storage strategy, schema design, caching approach, security model, diagrams and specs.

UI/UX Design (5,000 ADA): wireframes + high-fidelity dashboard prototype (global overview, contract page, drill-downs, filters, comparisons, export).

Tools/Infra (1,000 ADA): design tools, research references, early API access, and repository setup.



Milestone 2 — Backend Indexing, Data Pipeline & Analytics API (34,000 ADA)



Backend/Blockchain Data Engineering (18,000 ADA): build ingestion/indexing integration, normalize on-chain data into analytics-friendly records, compute v1 metrics, and implement the processing jobs (batch/near-real-time).

API Engineering (7,000 ADA): analytics API endpoints, query optimization, pagination, caching, rate limiting, and OpenAPI docs.

Database & Storage (4,000 ADA): schema implementation, performance tuning (indexes/partitions), retention strategy, and backup approach.

Testing & Security Hardening (3,000 ADA): integration tests, replay reliability tests, basic threat model controls, secret handling, and audit-ready logs.

Infrastructure & Tooling (2,000 ADA): hosted backend environment, monitoring/logging, and indexing/API credits for consistent testnet ingestion.



Milestone 3 — Frontend Dashboard Development (26,000 ADA)



Frontend Engineering (15,000 ADA): build the dashboard app, routing, state management, charts/tables, filters, comparisons, and contract profile pages.

Data Visualization & UX Implementation (5,000 ADA): implement readable, actionable views (success/failure breakdowns, time-series trends, top contracts/dApps, interactors), and responsive design.

Backend Integration (3,000 ADA): connect to analytics APIs, handle loading/empty/error states, caching on the client, and export/share flows.

QA & Validation (2,000 ADA): verify chart accuracy vs API responses, usability checks, and cross-browser tests.

Infra (1,000 ADA): staging deployment for the dashboard and basic uptime monitoring.



Milestone 4 — Public Beta Launch, Community Engagement & Close-Out (14,000 ADA)



Beta Launch & Operations (4,000 ADA): deploy public beta environment, uptime monitoring, incident response plan, and iterative patching.

Community Engagement & Feedback Loop (3,000 ADA): announcements, onboarding guide, feedback form, issue triage workflow, and at least one demo/AMA or recorded walkthrough.

Iteration Release from Beta Feedback (2,000 ADA): deliver fixes/improvements based on community testing and prioritized issues.

Documentation & Tutorials (2,000 ADA): user docs, metric glossary, FAQs, and short how-to guides linked from the app.

Close-out Report & Summary Video (3,000 ADA): completion report (PDF), artifact index, budget reconciliation, and 2–3 minute project summary/demo video.



We’ll attach each milestone cost summary to the corresponding delivery (tagged releases, demo links, docs, beta engagement links, and metrics artifacts) for transparency and accountability.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
Our 96,000 ADA budget represents strong value for the Cardano ecosystem because it funds a public-good analytics prototype that improves how developers, users, and researchers understand real on-chain smart contract activity—something the ecosystem currently lacks at depth.



Why the spend is good value



Directly tied to deliverables: Most funds go to building the core infrastructure (indexing → processing → analytics API → dashboard). Each milestone produces verifiable outputs (code, live demo, docs, beta engagement, metrics, close-out), reducing waste and ensuring accountable execution.



Specialized work, high leverage: Smart contract analytics requires blockchain data engineering, backend/API design, and high-quality visualization. Funding experienced builders reduces rework and ensures the prototype is accurate, performant, and trusted.



Minimal “fluff” costs: We prioritize engineering, QA, and documentation over heavy marketing. “Community engagement” is scoped as practical adoption work—beta onboarding, demos, and feedback loops—to ensure the tool is actually used and improved.



Reusable ecosystem asset: The indexing patterns, analytics definitions, and APIs become building blocks for other Cardano tools (explorers, wallets, dApp monitoring). This multiplies the return on treasury spend beyond a single dashboard.



On-chain measurable impact: Value can be verified through indexed contracts, transaction volume analyzed, failure-rate insights surfaced, and community usage of exports/APIs—making results auditable rather than subjective.



Long-term ecosystem benefits (ROI)



Better developer decisions: Visibility into failures, trends, and activity patterns helps teams optimize contracts, reduce failed transactions, and improve user experience across dApps.



Better transparency for users: Clear contract behavior and activity dashboards increase trust and reduce information gaps that slow adoption.



Scalable foundation: Investing early in a clean data model and pipelines means future expansions (alerts, risk flags, DeFi/dApp segments, mainnet scaling) can happen with significantly lower marginal cost.



Accountability

We will run the project milestone-gated, publish open-source code, ship a public beta, document everything, and provide a close-out report with evidence and budget reconciliation—so the community can verify exactly what was delivered for each ADA spent.
